text: A comment left by jollysaintpete was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by riotdejaneiro, TonyHighwind, Weretrout, RedMange, gussiejives, 762, DHCJohn, Kennisiou, ih8jonmayr, logic, andrewthepig)

name: zefiel
text: There was a group named like that in the last Songfight.  Their rendition of 'Living at the corner of dude & Catastrophe' was voted second only to Frontalot. Now THAT's bold. (I like their version better, too) I'm guessing this strip predated them?

name: stuart
text: Holy shit, these comments are where I realize that Several Thousand Dollars In Motion is a name planted in my head by this strip and not, in fact, an actual Myspace-originating band. I could have sworn they were the guys who did the Snakes on a Plane theme.

name: zefiel
text: A comment left by zefiel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Thorfinn, jezebel, spiderbethlehem, andrewthepig)

name: rowboat
text: You enjoy a very bad, very fake band. Not that I dislike you as a person.

name: zefiel
text: I just like that song of theirs, never said i wore a tshirt of them when my wolf tshirts were in the washer. Sometimes it's okay to like stupid things

name: rowboat
text: You're right. It's none of my business, anyway.

name: tekende
text: Wolf T-shirts? Is there a band called Wolf, or do you wear T-shirts depicting wolves howling at moons and such?

name: stuart
text: "Wolf t-shirts" refer to the latter form of shirt worn by the awful kind of person.

name: jollysaintpete
text: hah, wasn't that made famous by some ridiculous rap group? they wore tall tees with wolves on them? i feel like i heard about this before

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
homeschoolers.

it's true.

they also sleep with wolf pillows until they're...
well...it is yet to be seen when it ceases.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
i really like that song, stuart. that is a really good song.

i once had a friend named stuart. do you know what happened to him?

he was trampled by the horse he was riding three weeks before we graduated high school.


the end.

name: riotdejaneiro
text: no moral!

name: cpnglxynchos
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: pants
text: i find the sexual homeboys to be a strange name, but no stranger than barenaked ladies...and with no better mental image associated.

name: chaesar
text: And if you read it too fast it comes out "The Homosexual Boys" which would just confuse all of their songs.

name: equinn2006
text: It rolls off the tongue, for me at least. And of course D'shawn is the de facto most Sexual of the Homeboys.

name: epicurus
text: The homosexual boys roll off of many people's tongues, actually.

name: bixschmix
text: A comment left by bixschmix was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by joeyramoney, worldbelow, Thorfinn, Ebessan, wotown)

name: geysershitdick
text: A-nu$$$ is the real talent.

name: dropkickpikachu
text: The best part of this strip is the bunny. I didn't even notice it the first time, but goddamn that's adorable.

name: tellumo
text: Oh totally . Little bunny all reachin' up, peekin' through the studio window, it's awesome.

name: mjfitzge
text:
haha, i didn't realize what that was... i thought pat was sitting in a really weird awkward position, like with his arms wrapped around his knee pulling it to his chest.

but yeah, it's clearly the bunny.

name: cherubrocker22
text: haha yes! i read this 10 times before i noticed him watching pat from the control room. wicked cute.

name: mattylite
text: ...his little lucky paws all up on the studio glass...

name: spinynorman
text: He goes from complete cartoon to somewhat natural between panels 2 and 3.

name: gmm
text: Yeah, that thing bumps it up to a 4 MAYBE even 5 for me.

name: agika
text: Kinda sucks when one of your artists is grounded.  And you're probably the one who grounded them.

name: closefriend
text: How did Little Nephew make the A-List? Did "Fuck Algebra" really sell that well?

name: nathanielperson
text: And given Ray's disapproval of the song's message, I'm surprised he even signed LN. Though I suppose it wouldn't look to good to have another label sign your own nephew.

name: centipede_damascus
text: The song of America is something you don't just do. The song sings itself through you. You have to be receptive to that.

name: hollis
text: Hollandaise looks on, waiting to be reunited with Pat.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hollandaise looks so cute with his paws up on the winders!!

name: snatch22
text: I really want Christ to release a Prime Time Records sampler.  Get a bunch of local bands together, and rename them.  Like, an R&B band like Boys 2 Men for the Sexual Homeboys, some old school 80's punk band for D   The Fags, an emo band for STDIM, and some rapper for Little Nephew.  Any suggestions for Naked Lady President?

name: epicurus
text: Cool idea, but you might have a bit of a wait ahead of you before Christ starts releasing music.

name: zem
text: <joke about tupac still releasing records>

name: landowmpg
text: I wrote this song a long time ago. A really long time ago..."

name: landowmpg
text: Quotation mark asymmetry sours my mind grapes.

name: molesticide
text: i would like to see Akinyele and R.A. the Rugged Man as the Sexual Homeboys, REM as Dick and the Fags, Starsailor for ST$, Eminem doing Nephew, and whatever today's contemporary college dumbass thinks is indie-rock for Naked Lady President.

name: ashoykh
text:
Hey mister can you tell me where a man can find a bed?
He just grinned and shook my hand, no was all he said.

name: rowboat
text: A comment left by rowboat was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, mashisoyo, Darthemed)

name: rowboat
text: Or you've nailed it.

name: hyetal
text: I like that.  I like it better than Pat's line in the comic.

name: idsyen
text: Do you guys realize that ashoykh is quoting "The Weight" by The Band? It is unclear.

name: rowboat
text: Yes, I realized that. My confusion was why he was doing that.

name: straw
text:
CAN
YOU
DIG IT

name: ford
text: This post has nothing to do with the comic, but it references such a source of raw, uncut awesome i am forced to give it a chubby.

name: songbirdspectre
text: i want a hollandaise.

name: tekende
text: All with that sauce ...

name: jesler729
text: I think that, somehow, Pat is more of a dick now.

name: plummet
text: (   THE FAGS )

name: tristanhw
text: What about sugar loadz? Then they can compare thier junk to dog food!

name: mollybloom11
text: I feel like this entire storyline probably came from Onstad needing an excuse to use the name "The Sexual Homeboys".  I'm not mad about it, either.

name: jormungandr
text:
Ray's note on STDiM is incredible. Not only does he hate one of the bands on his own label, but he wrote his own opinion of them down to remind himself of it when he goes over the list later, deciding who to contact.

"Sexual Homeboys? Yeah, okay, I'll call D'shawn. The Fags, no, Several Thousand- no, hate them. Naked Lady..."

name: jamb23
text:
Looking at it though, it appears that the annotation for STDiM is written by someone else - the handwriting is different and it's not all in upper case like the other ones. It looks a lot like Roast Beef's writing when trying to come up with a video for Ray's "Ass in Your Pants" - is there a chance Beef is so strongly against STDiM that he is compelled to write his disdain on every one of Ray's memos about the band?

Or maybe not, and I've killed the joke with my over-analysis? The latter, I'm going with the latter, yes.

name: ricnine
text: I totally hear Neil Young here, when Pat sings. That is what I hear here.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: What with November 2008 just around the corner 'Naked Lady President' becomes a much more terrifying idea.

name: wulvaine
text: Especially because NO ONE wants to see Hillary Clinton in any state of undress.

name: tekende
text: Not even her own husband.

name: anzio
text: ESPECIALLY not her husband.

name: saucy_jack
text: The Fags was a band in reality.

name: tekende
text: They were pretty good, as I recall.

name: tekende
text: Wait, I'm thinking of The Queers.

name: aseidel
text: Ray's still in the contemplative pose he started in panel 5 of last strip, and I bet he is again as he reflects on the state of his record label at the end of this one.
